description.en: The aim of this course is to provide information about Estonia, Tartu and Estonian culture and society through films (including documentaries) and museums in Tartu.
description.et: Kursuse jooksul külastatakse Tartus asuvaid muuseume ja vaadatakse nii dokumentaal- kui ka mängufilme.

objectives.en: In this course foreign students will get basic information about Estonia and Tartu, and Estonian culture and society.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda välisüliõpilastele algteadmisi Eestist ja Tartust ning Eesti kultuurist ja ühiskonnast.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the semester, the student acquires preliminary knowledge of Estonia and Tartu, and Estonian culture, by watching Estonian movies and visiting the museums of Tartu - the student is familiar with the main museums of Tartu and knows a collection of Estonian movies.
learning_outcomes.et: Õppeaine lõpuks omandab üliõpilane Eesti filme vaadates ja Tartu muuseume külastades esialgsed teadmised Eestist ja Tartust ning Eesti kultuurist - üliõpilane tunneb Tartu peamisi muuseume ja teab valitud eestikeelseid filme.

notes.et:
* The course is  O N L Y  for foreign/exchange students, not for local, Estonian students.
* The classes start at exact hour (NB! 1 2 . 0 0  or  1 4. 0 0)
* The course has a participation fee that covers the tickets and guides to the museums and the last, Estonian cuisine class. The fee for the course is 20 euros and should be paid by the second class.

The University of Tartu Museum / Tartu Ülikooli Muuseum - Lossi 25, Tartu
Estonian National Museum / Eesti Rahva Muuseum - Muuseumi tee 2, Tartu
KGB Cells Museum / KGB kongide museum - Riia 15b, Tartu
NB! visittartu.com/museums-every-taste

independent_work.et:
Terms:
·     Participation in about 80% of classes, 3 absences are allowed.
·     Handing in the assignments:
- notes about the museums visited and films watched (approximately 5-10 sentences about each museum or film). NB! Please do not write the summary of the film/museum but your own thoughts and emotions about it; analyze, do not describe.
- essay (about 1,5-2 pages, A4). Topic has to be related to Estonia/Estonian culture. NB! "An essay is a piece of writing which is written from an author's personal point of view."
- the assignment for the week of independent studies (no class: October 29 - November 4) is to write about any cultural event or encounter in Estonia (approximately 10-20 sentences) - be it a visit to a museum (besides the museums that we visit together), any place/town in Estonia, attending an event (concert, theatre, etc) or something else related to Estonian culture. It does not have to take place during this certain week.
·     The notes and the essay have to be sent by e-mail (Thursday's group A: katrin.janese@ut.ee; Tuesday's group B: sally.josiptsuk@ut.ee) at the end of the course as one file (.doc or .pdf). The name of the file should start with your name (for example: FirstnameSurname.doc).

description.et:
At the end of the course students will be asked

NB! Please focus on your own thoughts and emotions about it.

- to write an essay (approximately 1,5-2 pages, A4). Topic should be related to Estonia / Estonian culture.
NB! "An essay is a piece of writing which is written from an author's personal point of view."

At the end of the course students will be asked
- to present notes about the museums visited and films watched (approximately 5-10 sentences about each museum or film). 
NB! Please do not write the summary of the film/museum but focus on expressing your own thoughts and emotions about it.
